settings.title: Best Electrolytes for Keto
settings.text:
Starting a keto diet can be a powerful way to transform your health, but maintaining proper electrolyte balance is important to avoid common challenges like the keto flu. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned keto dieter, ensuring you get the right electrolytes is essential for supporting your metabolic health and sustaining ketosis.

Our electrolyte drops integrate seamlessly into any beverage, making them the ideal addition to your keto regimen, supporting you from your first step into ketosis and beyond.

‚úì Why Electrolytes are Essential for the Keto Diet
‚úì The Science Behind Electrolytes
‚úì Ingredients Keto Followers Should Avoid
‚úì Our Tailored Electrolyte Solution

Plus, a sneak peek of our favorite keto dieters!

settings.title: üß† Support Neurological and Muscular Functions
settings.text: Electrolytes are crucial for transmitting nerve signals and contracting muscles throughout the body. On a keto diet, low electrolyte levels can lead to symptoms like muscle cramps, spasms, or general weakness, impacting daily activities and exercise routines.

settings.title: ‚ù§Ô∏è Maintain Cellular and Heart Health
settings.text: Sodium and potassium work closely to maintain cellular function and heart health. These electrolytes help manage blood pressure and fluid balance. A common issue for those on keto is the significant reduction of these electrolytes, which can lead to complications like heart palpitations or altered heart rhythms.

settings.title: üíß Regulate Fluid Balance and Prevent Dehydration
settings.text: As your body adapts to a keto diet, increased diuresis (the increased production of urine) often occurs, which can quickly deplete electrolyte stores. Proper electrolyte management is essential to prevent dehydration, a common challenge during the initial phases of keto adaptation.

settings.title: üí™ Enhance Keto Adaptation and Reduce Keto Flu Symptoms
settings.text: Electrolyte imbalances are often responsible for the dreaded ‚Äúketo flu‚Äù‚Äîa collection of symptoms such as headaches, fatigue, and foggy brain experienced by some when first starting keto. Ensuring a balanced intake of electrolytes can alleviate these symptoms, smoothing your transition into ketosis.

settings.title: ‚ö°Ô∏è Support Sustained Energy Levels
settings.text: On keto, your body shifts from using glucose to fat as its primary energy source, a process that can be hampered by inadequate electrolyte levels. Maintaining a balanced electrolyte profile supports this metabolic change, ensuring your energy levels remain steady and high.

settings.title: The Importance of Electrolytes on a Keto Diet
settings.text_bottom:
When starting the keto lifestyle, understanding the vital role of electrolytes is as important as managing your carb intake. Electrolytes such as sodium, chloride, potassium, magnesium, and calcium support key functions that are essential for your success on a keto diet.

For those following a keto diet, maintaining the right balance of electrolytes is not just beneficial‚Äîit's essential. The shift in food intake on keto can naturally decrease electrolyte levels, making supplementation necessary.

Integrating Buoy‚Äôs keto-friendly electrolyte solutions can help you manage these levels effectively, ensuring your body performs optimally while in ketosis.

settings.suptext:
Adopting a keto diet can sometimes trigger the ‚Äúketo flu,‚Äù a set of flu-like symptoms that emerge as your body adapts to low carbohydrate intake and shifts its energy source to fats. This adjustment period is critical and can lead to noticeable shifts in your body‚Äôs electrolyte balance.

Symptoms of Keto Flu Linked to Electrolyte Imbalance:

The symptoms of the keto flu are often tied to a significant depletion of electrolytes, which are essential for maintaining cellular function and energy levels. Managing these symptoms effectively is crucial for a comfortable transition into ketosis and for your overall success on the diet.

Common symptoms include:

üò¥ Fatigue and Weakness: As the body shifts its main energy source from carbs to fats, a drop in electrolytes can lead to feelings of general fatigue and weakness.

ü§ï Headaches: Often a direct result of sodium deficiency, headaches are a common sign of the keto flu.

ü¶µ Muscle Cramps and Spasms: These uncomfortable sensations are typically due to low levels of magnesium and potassium.

üòµ Dizziness and Confusion: Reduced electrolyte levels can affect cognitive functions, leading to feelings of dizziness or mental cloudiness.

üò§ Irritability: Electrolyte imbalances can affect emotional well-being, making one feel unusually irritable or anxious.

settings.title: Easy electrolyte boost
settings.content: "You have no idea how much I have come to use Buoy. I take these drops with me everywhere."

settings.title: Electrolytes for recovery!
settings.content: Whether it's from a workout or from a night out, these electrolytes are a part of my recovery routine.

settings.suptitle: Managing Electrolyte Balance to Alleviate the Keto Flu:
settings.suptext:
Maintaining a balanced electrolyte level is essential, especially on a keto diet where your body undergoes significant fluid and mineral shifts. Here are straightforward and practical steps to manage your electrolyte balance effectively:

üßÇ Increase Salt Intake: On a keto diet, your body excretes more sodium. It's important to compensate for this loss by adding extra salt to your meals or consuming broth. Aim for an additional 1-2 grams of salt per day, depending on your activity level and how your body responds during ketosis.

üîç Supplement With Magnesium: Since it's hard to obtain sufficient magnesium from keto-friendly food alone, consider taking a magnesium supplement of 200-400 mg per day. This helps prevent cramps, improve sleep quality, and support muscle and nerve function.

üçå Boost Potassium Levels: Increase your intake of potassium-rich foods like avocados, nuts, and leafy greens. For those needing a greater boost, a potassium supplement of 1000-2000 mg per day can be safe, but it's best to consult with a healthcare provider to tailor the dosage to your specific needs.

üí¶ Hydrate: Aim to drink at least 2-3 liters of water daily to manage the increased urine production a keto diet can stimulate. Enhance hydration by adding electrolyte drops or tablets to your water, replenishing the electrolytes lost.

‚ö° Try Electrolyte Supplements: Most of us don‚Äôt get enough electrolytes through diet alone. Consider using electrolyte supplements like Buoy‚Äôs keto-friendly drops that provide a balanced blend of essential minerals without added sugars or carbs.

By following these guidelines, you can help ensure that your transition to and maintenance of a keto diet is as smooth and effective as possible, minimizing the risk of imbalances and the discomforts associated with the keto flu.

settings.content:
My Go-To for Long Runs
As an avid runner with a sensitive stomach, finding hydration that works has always been a challenge. But during a recent half marathon, I discovered the magic of Buoy. A simple squirt into my water transformed my hydration without the usual discomfort. Buoy is now my go-to for those demanding distances when I can‚Äôt carry as much water as I need.

It‚Äôs a Game-Changer!
Buoy has been a game-changer for me! It‚Äôs become an essential part of my pre-run routine, significantly enhancing my hydration and making my runs feel more effortless. Post-run, it‚Äôs my go-to for quick hydration and recovery. The convenience of the squirt bottle is just the cherry on top!

Better Hydration, Less Mess
I‚Äôm a distance runner who recently started running in hotter weather. I quickly realized that my previous hydration habits weren‚Äôt cutting it anymore, so I tried Buoy Hydration Drops. Now, staying hydrated, whether I'm in the car or on the trail, has never been easier or less messy.

Great Replacement for Hydration Tablets
I purchased Buoy as a replacement for those electrolyte tablets. I need to supplement my water to replace my electrolytes after runs, but it‚Äôs very hard for me to stomach flavored additives. I love Buoy and feel great after drinking it!

settings.title: The Science Behind Our Electrolytes
settings.text:
At Buoy, we dive deep into the science of hydration to tailor our electrolyte solutions for runners. Understanding that each run demands a unique hydration strategy, we've crafted our products to deliver the perfect balance of essential electrolytes like sodium, chloride, potassium, magnesium and calcium.

This focused approach ensures you're equipped with what you need for performance and recovery, making Buoy an essential part of your running kit.


Precision-Formulated for Runners

Our team of scientists and nutrition experts have dedicated countless hours to understanding the nuanced electrolyte and hydration needs of runners. This research has informed every aspect of our product development process, resulting in electrolyte solutions precisely balanced for the demands of running.

The Key Electrolytes in Focus

üßÇ Sodium: Essential for maintaining fluid balance, sodium is crucial for runners. It helps retain water, preventing dehydration during long runs. It also plays a role in muscle function and prevents cramps, ensuring you can keep pushing forward.

üåü Chloride: Along with sodium, chloride helps regulate cellular hydration, ensuring that your muscles and organs function efficiently during intense workouts. For runners, maintaining adequate chloride levels is vital for preventing dehydration and supporting overall performance and recovery.

üçå Potassium: This electrolyte works closely with sodium to maintain water balance and is vital for muscle and nerve function. Adequate potassium levels can help prevent muscle cramps and facilitate efficient muscle contractions, keeping your stride strong and steady.

üîç Magnesium: Magnesium's role in muscle health is undeniable. It aids in muscle recovery, reducing soreness and inflammation and allowing for quicker bounce back after rigorous runs. It also supports energy production, providing a boost to your endurance.

ü•õ Calcium: Integral for muscle contractions and nerve signaling, calcium ensures your muscles work efficiently. For runners, this means smoother, more powerful runs with a lower risk of cramps and muscle fatigue.

Beyond Electrolytes: Vitamins and Trace Minerals

In addition to these core electrolytes, Buoy‚Äôs Hydration Drops are enriched with a blend of vitamins and trace minerals. These elements support overall health, energy metabolism and the body‚Äôs natural recovery processes, further enhancing your running performance and endurance.

The Outcome: Optimized Performance and Recovery

By integrating Buoy into your hydration strategy, you're not just quenching thirst; you're fueling your body with scientifically formulated nutrition. This strategic blend of electrolytes and nutrients is designed to meet the exhaustive demands of running, ensuring you perform at your peak and recover more swiftly.

The science behind our electrolytes is clear: Buoy‚Äôs hydration solutions are more than a supplement; they're a critical tool for runners dedicated to achieving their personal bests. Whether you're training for a marathon, hitting the trails or sprinting on the track, Buoy supports every step with the purest, most effective hydration science has to offer.

settings.title: Can electrolytes improve my running performance and recovery?
settings.answer: Absolutely! Electrolytes play a vital role in maintaining hydration and supporting muscle function, both essential for optimal running performance and efficient recovery. Buoy's electrolyte solutions are specifically designed to replenish lost electrolytes during intense physical activity like running, helping you perform better and recover faster.

settings.title:
What sets Buoy‚Äôs electrolyte solutions apart from traditional sports drinks?

¬†
settings.answer:
Buoy's electrolyte solutions stand out for their clean and pure formulation. Unlike many traditional sports drinks that contain added sugars, sweeteners, and artificial flavors, Buoy's electrolyte drops offer a sugar-free, unflavored option that provides essential electrolytes without unnecessary additives.

Additionally, Buoy's liquid form factor ensures rapid absorption, delivering electrolytes in their most bioavailable form for maximum effectiveness.

settings.title: When is the best time to use Buoy‚Äôs electrolytes during my running routine?
settings.answer:
Buoy's electrolyte products are versatile and can be used at various stages of your running routine. For optimal hydration, it's beneficial to incorporate Buoy before, during, and after your runs.

Pre-run, Buoy helps prepare your body for optimal performance by ensuring adequate hydration. During your run, Buoy aids in maintaining electrolyte balance and preventing dehydration and muscle cramps. Post-run, Buoy supports efficient recovery by replenishing lost electrolytes and promoting hydration.

settings.title: Can Buoy‚Äôs electrolyte products help prevent dehydration and muscle cramps during long runs?
settings.answer: Yes! Buoy's electrolyte solutions are formulated to help prevent dehydration and muscle cramps, particularly during long runs or intense physical activity. By replenishing essential electrolytes like sodium, chloride, potassium, magnesium and calcium, Buoy supports proper hydration and muscle function, reducing the risk of dehydration and cramping and helping you maintain peak performance throughout your run.

settings.title: What should I do if I experience signs of electrolyte imbalance during a run?
settings.answer:
If you experience signs of electrolyte imbalance during a run, such as muscle cramps, fatigue, or dizziness, it's essential to address them right away. Stop running and take a break to rehydrate and replenish electrolytes.

Add a light squeeze of Buoy's electrolyte and mineral drops to any drink to quickly restore electrolyte balance. Additionally, stretching and massaging affected muscles can help alleviate cramping. If symptoms persist or worsen, seek medical attention promptly.
